Package net.jxta.content

Content objects are container objects that can hold arbitrary data and are associated with a JXTA ID (replacing the older Codat API).

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ContentProvider ContentProvider implementations define a single methodology and/or protocol to obtain content from a (potentially) remote data source.
ContentProviderListener Interface provided to notify interested parties of ContentProvider events which may be useful to them.
ContentProviderSPI Service provider interface used to define new implementations of ContentProvider search and transfer mechanism.
ContentService The ContentService is intended to be the end-user's main access point when working with Content and Content transfers.
ContentShare ContentShare objects represent the server / data provider portion of a Content transfer mechanism.
ContentShareListener This interface should expose events which should be common to most/all implementations and which provide information relevant to allowing the application a mechanism by which to inform the end user of the share activity.
ContentTransfer ContentTransfer objects represent the client / requesting side of a Content transfer mechanism.
ContentTransferAggregator This interface represents a content transfer which is acting as a front for multiple ContentTransfer instances, all of which are working to obtain a single Content instance.
ContentTransferAggregatorListener Listener interface used for monitoring changes of state within a ContentTransferAggregator instance.
ContentTransferListener Listener interface used for monitoring the progress of a Content transfer.
 

Class Summary
Content The common container for managing content (arbitrary binary data) within JXTA.
ContentID An identifier that enables canonical references to be made to a Content instance within the context of a specific peer group.
ContentProviderEvent ContentProvider event object containing information related to the event being published.
ContentProviderEvent.Builder Builder pattern.
ContentShareEvent ContentShare event object, containing information related to the event being published.
ContentShareEvent.Builder Builder pattern.
ContentTransferAggregatorEvent ContentTransfer event object, containing information related to the event being published.
ContentTransferAggregatorEvent.Builder Builder pattern.
ContentTransferEvent ContentTransfer event object, containing information related to the event being published.
ContentTransferEvent.Builder Builder pattern.
Metadata Medata Content instances are special Content instances that contain information about another Content instance.
NullContentTransfer This class wraps an existing Content in an ContentTransfer object.
 

Enum Summary
ContentSourceLocationState Enumeration used to represent the remote source location status provided by TransferListener events.
ContentTransferState Enumeration used to represent the transfer state provided by TransferListener events.
 

Exception Summary
TransferCancelledException Exception to be thrown when an active transfer is cancelled.
TransferException Base exception for representing terminal Content transfer problems.
TransferFailedException Exception to be thrown when a transfer has irrecoverably failed.
 

Package net.jxta.content Description

Content objects are container objects that can hold arbitrary data and are associated with a JXTA ID (replacing the older Codat API). This package is intended to provide a definition of Content as well as provide an interface to share and reetrieve the Content to and from remote peers.

This API may appear to be quite complex for such a simple task. This is due to the fact that it was designed to be able to provide a unified front-end to the programmer while retaining the option to host multiple transfer implementations concurrently. Since each transfer implementation may have it's own specific controls and telemetry, this package was designed such that objects created for the user by each transfer implementation would be directly accessible by the user, allowing for polymorphic checks to expose more functionality than appears in this common API.

For most uses, the following are probably the best entry point into this package:

  • Content: The container for arbitary data
  • ContentService: Allows Content to be shared and retrieved
  • ContentShare: Represents Content which has been made available to remote peers
  • ContentTransfer: Represents Content which has been made available by one or more remote peers and is being retrieved to this peer

See Also:
net.jxta.id, Content, ContentService, ContentShare, ContentTransfer, JXTA Protocols Specification : Protocols
